page.title: 23The new Ferry Terminal
page.content:
This is the Ferry at the new Ferry Terminal in Clachan. It was finished in August 2010. There was a special opening cermony and Raasay Primary pupils performed Gaelic songs for the Transport Minister.It was a very special day. We had to get a new Terminal because the one in Suisinish was unstable. This is the oil tanker coming off the Ferry to deliver oil to people's houses.The Ferry Terminal opened on the sixteenth of August 2010. There is a new waiting room and big ships can now dock at the pier. Our Ferry takes twelve cars and can carry a hundred and fifty passengers. It is a beautiful Terminal in a lovely location and the ferry provides jobs for the local people. 28/9/11
Contribution by: Rachel P6
